original: CONFIDENTIAL TREATMENT - REDACTED VERSION CORIO INC.
ollama_generated:
DISCRETIONARY NON-DISCLOSURE - MODIFIED VERSION OF CORIO INC.

Corio Inc. hereby grants to the Recipient, on a discretionary and limited basis, the right to access and review the Confidential Information in a redacted form only. It is understood that the Recipient shall make all reasonable efforts to protect and maintain the confidentiality of the Redacted Version, but shall not be held liable for any unintended disclosure of the underlying unredacted Confidential Information if it can demonstrate that it acted in good faith and without negligence.

original: The following terms shall have the following meanings:
ollama_generated:
In this agreement, the following terms will be understood as follows:

To ensure clarity and consistency, let us define the key terms used herein:

1. "Obligations" encompasses the tasks, duties, or responsibilities that one party is bound to perform under this agreement, but does not necessarily imply a strict liability or consequence for non-performance; rather, it signifies an expectation of good faith and reasonable effort.

2. "Event of Default" refers to any condition or circumstance that breaches the terms set forth in this agreement, however minor, which may trigger the right of the non-breaching party to seek remedies under applicable law. It is important to note that such an event is not a prerequisite for a party to exercise its rights or remedies under this agreement.

3. "Force Majeure Event" encompasses any external, unforeseeable, and insurmountable circumstances beyond the control of either party, which may prevent a party from fulfilling its obligations under this agreement. Such events include but are not limited to acts of God, government actions, war, terrorism, or other catastrophic events, provided that such circumstances were neither foreseeable nor avoidable by the affected party.

original: 1.5      "CORIO SERVICES" means the hosting services offered by Corio to its Customers in which Corio allows Customers to access the Corio Servers.
ollama_generated: 1.5    "Corio SERVICES" denotes the web-hosting facilities made accessible by Corio to its Clients, wherein Corio grants its clients permissions to utilize and interact with the Corio Server Infrastructure. It is understood that the client bears responsibility for ensuring compliance with any specific access requirements or protocols as outlined in the Service Level Agreement or otherwise communicated by Corio.

original: 1.10     "SOFTWARE" means Changepoint's proprietary software described in EXHIBIT A attached hereto and made a part hereof, in object code form only, and any Updates or Upgrades (as defined below) thereto. The Software shall also include any Application Programming Interfaces ("API") provided by Changepoint to Corio, but such API intellectual property shall not be sublicenseable to Customers.

original: 2.       GRANT OF RIGHTS.
ollama_generated:
2. AWARDED PRIVILEGES.

Upon the fulfillment of all obligations by the Client under this Agreement, the Service Provider hereby grants the Client a non-exclusive, revocable, and limited license to use the Services provided hereunder, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein. Any failure by the Client to adhere to these terms may result in the immediate termination of this license. The Service Provider reserves the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the Services at any time without prior notice to the Client.

original: 2.1      HOSTING SOFTWARE LICENSE. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Changepoint hereby grants to Corio a fee-bearing, irrevocable, nonexclusive, nontransferable (except in accordance with Section 14.1 of this Agreement) license in the Territory to (i) reproduce the Software in machine executable object code format only for installation on the Corio Servers; (ii) install multiple copies of the Software on Corio's Servers which will be made remotely accessible to Corio's Customers for their internal business purposes, (iii) permit limited access to and use of the Software by Customers through Corio Servers solely for such Customer's internal business purposes; (iv) sublicense an unlimited number of Customers to access and use the Software only through the installation on Corio Servers solely for such Customer's internal business purposes; and (v) use Changepoint's tools and utilities, if any, subject to any restrictions placed on the Changepoint by third party software providers and payment of any applicable fees required by such third parties, to configure, integrate and manage the Software. Corio shall not authorize Customers to download or reproduce the Software for use except as necessary in connection with the Corio Services. Except as specifically authorized by this Agreement, no license is granted under this Agreement to Corio to distribute the Software to its Customers or for use other than as part of the Corio Services.
modified:
2.1 LICENSE GRANT FOR HOSTING SOFTWARE. In accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, Changepoint grants to Corio, on a fee-bearing, revocable (at Changepoint's sole discretion), nonexclusive, nontransferable (except as expressly permitted under Section 14.1 of this Agreement) basis, a license within the Territory to:

(i) Reproduce the Software in machine executable object code format for installation on Corio Servers.
(ii) Install an unlimited number of copies of the Software on Corio's Servers, which may be made remotely accessible to Corio's Customers for their internal business purposes.
(iii) Provide limited access and use of the Software to Customers via Corio Servers, solely for their internal business needs.
(iv) Sublicense an unlimited number of Customers to access and utilize the Software, exclusively through installation on Corio Servers, for their respective internal business purposes.
(v) Utilize Changepoint's tools and utilities (if any), subject to any restrictions imposed by third-party software providers and payment of any necessary fees as demanded by such third parties, for configuring, integrating, and managing the Software.

However, Corio is prohibited from authorizing Customers to download or reproduce the Software unless essential for Corio Services provision. This Agreement does not grant any license to Corio for the distribution of the Software to its Customers beyond the scope of the Corio Services, nor for uses other than those explicitly stipulated within this Agreement, except as expressly authorized herein.

original: 2.4      DEMONSTRATION LICENSE. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Changepoint hereby grants to Corio a nonexclusive, nontransferable (except in accordance with Section 14.1 of this Agreement) royalty-free, fully paid up right and license in the Territory, on Corio Servers, to make a reasonable number of copies of the Demonstration Software solely for demonstration purposes to potential Customers. Demonstration Software shall be made available to Corio's sales personnel and the parties agree to cooperate to make the Changepoint demonstration database available to Corio sales personnel on an ongoing basis. Corio shall not distribute any demonstration copies of the Software. Corio shall not demonstrate the Software to any one Customer for more than sixty (60) days from the start of that Customer demonstration, and Corio shall not demonstrate the Software to more than ten (10) Software Users at any one time. Further, the demonstration copies shall not permit the entry of additional data.
modified:
2.4 DEMONSTRATION PERIOD LICENSE: In accordance with this Agreement's terms and conditions, Changepoint grants Corio a non-exclusive, non-assignable (except as specified in Section 14.1), royalty-free, fully paid license, within the defined Territory, to install an unlimited number of copies of the Demonstration Software for demonstration purposes towards prospective clients. It is expected that both parties will collaborate to ensure the continuous availability of a Changepoint demonstration database to Corio's sales team.

However, it should be noted that Changepoint reserves the right to determine the appropriate number of copies installed on Corio Servers. Corio may distribute demonstration copies of the Software, but only upon written approval from Changepoint. Furthermore, Corio is permitted to demonstrate the Software to an individual Customer for a period exceeding sixty (60) days, provided that the duration does not exceed ninety (90) days and subject to Changepoint's prior consent. Similarly, there is no limitation on the number of Software Users Corio can demonstrate the Software to simultaneously. Lastly, while the demonstration copies will allow basic functionality, they will not support data entry or modification beyond that which was initially input by Changepoint.

2.5 LICENSE FOR DISTRIBUTION: Corio is granted the privilege to offer licenses for the Software to any of its clients (hereinafter referred to as "Corio Clients") under Corio's terms and conditions, consistent with Changepoint's standard Distribution Agreement ("Changepoint's Distribution Agreement"). It is understood that Corio and Changepoint will enter into Changepoint's Distribution Agreement within sixty (60) days following the Effective Date. The agreement's terms shall closely mirror the copy of Changepoint's Distribution Agreement provided to Corio, with any discrepancies or inconsistencies being resolved in favor of this Agreement.

Under Changepoint's Distribution Agreement, Changepoint will offer Corio a **discount from its standard list price for such Software licenses up to Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000U.S.) per calendar year based on their respective list prices, and a regular discount thereafter. This pricing structure shall apply for each calendar year during which Corio holds distribution rights under this Section 2.5. For Corio Clients who acquire Changepoint Software licenses from Corio in accordance with this Section 2.5 and Changepoint's Distribution Agreement, Corio shall remit to Changepoint a Software Support and Maintenance fee equivalent to ** of the fees charged for Changepoint's standard support and maintenance services for the Software Support and Maintenance services provided by Changepoint as detailed in Section 5.3 of this Agreement and EXHIBIT C attached herein and incorporated by reference, as well as for Updates and Upgrades.

Provided that Corio fulfills its obligations to pay the Software support and maintenance fee as outlined in this Section 2.5, Changepoint's responsibility for providing Software Support and Maintenance shall continue after the termination or expiration of this Agreement for all Users granted access to the Software prior to such termination or expiration, for the duration of their rights to use the Software under agreements between Corio and its Clients. Under no circumstances will Changepoint contact Corio Clients regarding non-hosting license sales unless explicitly requested by Corio. Furthermore, if a Corio Client reaches out to Changepoint to purchase a Software license independently of Corio's services, Changepoint shall redirect that client to Corio. Any confidential information related to this matter has been submitted separately to the Securities and Exchange Commission in accordance with a request for confidential treatment.

original: 3.       DELIVERY OF SOFTWARE.
ollama_generated:
3. SOFTWARE DELIVERY PROVISIONS:

In this Agreement, the Contractor shall make all reasonable efforts to provide the Client with access to the Software in a timely and functional manner, subject to the following conditions:

a) The Contractor shall not be liable for any delays or failures in the delivery of the Software due to factors beyond its control, such as internet service interruptions or software incompatibilities that were not reasonably foreseeable.

b) In the event that the Client encounters any issues with the Software, it is the Client's responsibility to report these problems promptly to the Contractor so that appropriate actions can be taken to resolve them. The Contractor shall make reasonable attempts to rectify the issues reported by the Client in a timely manner.

c) The Contractor shall not be obligated to support or maintain the Software beyond the term of this Agreement, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing between the parties.

d) In case the Software is found to contain any errors or defects that were not reasonably foreseeable at the time of delivery, the Client agrees to provide the Contractor with a reasonable amount of time to correct these issues, subject to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

original: 4        FEES.
ollama_generated:
4. FEE ARRANGEMENTS.

In this Agreement, the Client shall not be obligated to pay any fees until the Services have been completed by the Service Provider to the satisfaction of both parties and accepted by the Client. Upon such acceptance, the Client will remit payment within ten (10) business days. If, during the provision of Services, the Client requests a modification or additional work that was not initially agreed upon, such modifications or additional work shall be charged at the Service Provider's then-current hourly rate.

original: 4.5      REPORTING. Within thirty (30) days following the end of each calendar month, Corio will submit to Changepoint a report in a form reasonably acceptable to both parties setting forth the number of Customers and Software Users which have been licensed to use the Software during the preceding month, as well as the Application Management Revenue received by Corio during the preceding month. The report shall also set forth all amounts collected by Corio pursuant to the Distribution License granted under Section 2.5 of this Agreement during the preceding month, and a calculation of all amounts due to Changepoint for such distributions by Corio during the preceding month.
ollama_generated:
4.5 REPORTING MODIFICATIONS: Changepoint shall have the right to request, within a reasonable timeframe following the end of each calendar month, a report from Corio in a mutually agreeable format. The report should include an estimation of the number of Customers and Software Users who are actively using the Software during that specific period, as well as the Application Management Revenue generated by Changepoint during the same timeframe. Furthermore, the report will encompass all amounts received by Corio from sales made under the Distribution License, as outlined in Section 2.5, for the preceding month. Additionally, the report shall contain a calculation of any distributions owed to Corio based on this revenue and the timeframe mentioned above.

This modification ensures that Changepoint's request for reports does not have to be made within thirty (30) days following the end of each calendar month, allowing for more flexibility in timing while still maintaining the essential reporting requirements outlined.

original: Changepoint agrees to provide Level 2 support and maintenance to Corio for the first four (4) months after the first Customer commences using the Software in connection with the Corio Services. Corio shall escalate any technical support questions or problems it is unable to answer or resolve directly to Changepoint for Changepoint to resolve as described in the schedule set forth in EXHIBIT C hereto. The support described in this Section 5.3 and EXHIBIT C hereto shall be provided to Corio, but Changepoint shall have no obligation to provide any Software Support or Maintenance services to other third parties. Subject to Corio's payment of the Software revenue sharing fees as set forth in EXHIBIT B hereto and the Software Support and Maintenance fee as provided in Section 2.5 of this Agreement, Changepoint's Software Support and Maintenance obligation shall continue after termination or expiration of this Agreement with respect to all Software Users granted access to the Software prior to termination or expiration of this Agreement for the remaining duration of each such Software Users' rights to use the Software pursuant to agreements between Corio and its Customers. Corio shall assign up to five (5) trained persons to contact Changepoint on Software Support and Maintenance matters within the scope of Changepoint's responsibility under EXHIBIT C.
ollama_generated:
Changepoint acknowledges its commitment to offering Level 2 technical assistance and maintenance to Corio for an initial period of four (4) months, commencing from when the first Customer initiates utilizing the Software in conjunction with the Corio Services. In the event that Corio encounters any technical questions or issues beyond its capability to resolve autonomously, it shall promptly forward these matters to Changepoint for appropriate resolution as outlined in EXHIBIT C appended herein. It is understood that the support detailed in this Section 5.3 and EXHIBIT C serves exclusively Corio; however, Changepoint maintains no obligation to extend any Software Support or Maintenance services to external parties.

Pursuant to Corio's timely remittance of the Software revenue sharing fees as specified in EXHIBIT B and the Software Support and Maintenance fee as stated in Section 2.5 of this Agreement, Changepoint's Software Support and Maintenance obligation persists post-termination or expiration of this contract, solely for those Software Users who have previously been granted access to the Software before the termination or expiration of this agreement. These users may continue to benefit from Changepoint's Software Support and Maintenance for the remaining period of their rights to employ the Software as per agreements between Corio and its Customers.

Corio is obliged to designate up to five (5) adequately trained individuals to serve as primary points of contact for all matters concerning Software Support and Maintenance within Changepoint's area of responsibility, as outlined in EXHIBIT C.

original: 5.4      MANAGEMENT MEETINGS. The parties agree to meet either in person or via teleconference on no less than a quarterly basis to discuss, without limitation, engineering, feature-functionality and architecture-related issues as they pertain to the Software. The specific topics of the meetings will be determined on a meeting-by-meeting basis. Each party shall appoint a product manager to coordinate these meetings.

Each party retains the autonomy to appoint, or change at their discretion, a product manager responsible for coordinating these meetings.

original: 7        WARRANTIES AND DISCLAIMER.
modified:
7. IMPLIED WARRANTIES AND LIMITATIONS ON LIABILITY.

In contrast to the previous clause, this section outlines the implicit assurances we provide in our services and sets boundaries for our liability. While we strive for excellence, it's essential to understand that our services are provided "as is" and "as available," with no implied warranties of any kind, either express or implied, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement.

Regarding liability, in the event that any claims, losses, or damages (including consequential damages) arise from the use of our services, our total aggregate liability shall be limited to the amount paid by you for the relevant service during the period when the cause of action arose. This limitation applies regardless of legal theory, whether in contract, tort, or otherwise.

By engaging with our services, you acknowledge and accept this limitation on our liability and the absence of any implied warranties.

original: 11       TERM AND TERMINATION.

11. DURATION AND DISCONTINUANCE.

In the event of any Party's desire to terminate this Agreement prior to its natural expiration, they shall have the right to provide written notice to the other Party at least thirty (30) days before such discontinuance. The Parties acknowledge and accept that upon termination, each shall be responsible for fulfilling their obligations up to the date of termination, and no further obligations or liabilities will arise thereafter unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

original: 11.3     EFFECT OF TERMINATION OR EXPIRATION. The following Sections shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement according to the provisions of this Section 11.3: 2.1, 2,2, 2.3, 4.2, 4,5, 4.6, 4.7, 5.3, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 14 and Exhibits B and C. Changepoint's obligation to provide Software Support and Maintenance to Corio and its Customers shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement for the remaining term of any contracts Corio has with such Customers to continue providing the Corio Services, provided Corio continues to make its revenue share fee payments (and Software Support and Maintenance payments under Section 2.5 of this Agreement with respect to those licenses) to Changepoint as specified in this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the license grants in Sections 2.1 and 2.2 of this Agreement, and Changepoint's continuing obligation to provide Software Support and Maintenance under Sections 4.2 and 5.3 of this Agreement shall terminate if Changepoint terminates this Agreement for Corio's non-payment or other material breach according to the provisions of Section 11.2 of this Agreement.

original: 12.3     LICENSE. Changepoint v 5.1 2. DEMOSTRATIVE SOFTWARE REPRESENTATION.

In this contract, it is understood that the Demonstrative Software Representation (DSR) provided by us serves as a general illustration of the software's functionality and capabilities. The client acknowledges that the DSR may not encompass all potential functionalities or customizations, and its performance may differ from the final product due to factors beyond our control. original: 1.   RELATIONSHIP MANAGERS. The parties' Relationship Managers would attempt to meet at mutually agreeable times no less than every quarter to review and coordinate sales efforts and review customer response to the Software and the Corio Services, and address other topics related to this Agreement.
modified: 1. FLEXIBLE RELATIONSHIP MEETINGS: The parties' designated Relationship Managers may opt for meetings at mutually convenient intervals, not necessarily adhering to a strict quarterly schedule, with the goal of discussing sales strategies, evaluating customer feedback on the Software and Corio Services, and addressing any matters pertaining to this Agreement as they arise. The frequency and timing of such meetings shall be determined by the mutual agreement of both parties.

original: 2.   JOINT MARKETING PLANS. During the term of this Agreement the parties agree to develop, review and submit to each other new and continuing marketing plans with respect to the Corio Services and the Software, respectively.
ollama_generated: 2. COLLABORATIVE MARKETING STRATEGIES. Throughout the duration of this Agreement, it is understood that the parties shall engage in a collaborative process for the creation, evaluation, and submission to one another of proposed marketing strategies regarding the Corio Services and Software, respectively. However, the ultimate decision on implementation of any proposed marketing plan remains with each party independently. This does not imply an obligation to act upon the other party's suggestions, but rather a commitment to discuss and consider them thoughtfully.

original: 3.   MARKETING FUND. Within six (6) months after the Effective Date of the Agreement, Corio and Changepoint each would contribute to a marketing fund to be jointly managed by the parties to promote the sale and marketing of the Corio Services and the Software. Each party's initial amount of contribution is Fifty Thousand dollars ($50,000U.S.).
ollama_generated: 3. JOINT MARKETING FUND. Upon the Effective Date of this Agreement, Changepoint shall initiate the creation of a joint marketing fund, with Corio following suit no later than three (3) months thereafter. This fund will be managed independently by each party, with no obligation to consult one another on decisions regarding its use or allocation. The initial contribution from Corio is Fifty Thousand dollars ($50,000U.S.), and Changepoint's contribution will be at its discretion and not limited in any way by this Agreement.

original: This Agreement shall be deemed to be made in the State of New York, and Customer agrees not to commence any action, suit or proceeding against Changepoint or any affiliate of Changepoint or any of their employees, officers or directors in any jurisdiction other than the State of New 9.10     DISPUTE RESOLUTION AND ARBITRATION In the event that any dispute or disagreement between Customer and Changepoint with respect to the interpretation of any provision of this Agreement, the performance of Changepoint or Customer under this Agreement, or any other matter that is in dispute between the parties related to this Agreement, upon the written request of either party, the parties will meet for the purpose of resolving such dispute. modified:
Clause:
This Agreement shall be construed under the laws of the State of New York, and either party reserves the right to instigate legal action, litigation, or proceedings against the other in any jurisdiction they deem appropriate.

Regarding dispute resolution, should any disagreement arise between the parties concerning the interpretation of this Agreement, performance under it, or any matter pertinent to this contract, the following process shall apply: Upon a written request from either party, a consultation will take place for the purpose of resolving the dispute. The parties are not obligated to adhere to this informal resolution process; however, they agree to engage in good faith discussions without the immediate need for formal proceedings.

In the event that informal discussions prove unsuccessful, either party may pursue legal action in a court of their choosing. This clause does not prevent the parties from seeking provisional remedies or emergency relief, as appropriate and allowed by law, prior to the completion of the informal dispute resolution process.

original: No person may be appointed as an arbitrator unless he or she is independent of the Applicant and Respondent, is skilled in the subject matter of the Dispute and is not directly or indirectly carrying on or involved in a business being carried on in competition with the business of the parties. The decision of the arbitration panel shall be made by a majority vote or by the sole arbitrator, as the case may be. In the event of the failure of the arbitration panel to reach a majority decision, the decision of the chairperson shall constitute the decision of the arbitration panel. The venue for the arbitration shall be at the City of New York, New York unless otherwise agreed to by the parties in writing.
ollama_generated: An individual may serve as an arbitrator provided they are not affiliated with either the Applicant or the Respondent, possess expertise relevant to the Dispute's subject matter, and do not participate in a business that directly or indirectly competes with the parties' operations. In cases where the arbitration panel cannot reach a majority vote, the decision will be made by the sole arbitrator appointed. If a sole arbitrator is not present, the arbitration panel's decision shall be deemed to be the chairperson's decision. The location for the arbitration proceedings will initially be set at New York City, New York; however, this can be altered through a written agreement between both parties.
